string.text: I want to ask you something.
Nevermind.
Okay.
Thanks.
About what?
Sure.
Go ahead.
Yes?
I already told you.
I don't know much more.
That's all I know. Ask someone else.
God damn, man. You got a hard-on on for me? Ask someone else.
Not much more I can tell ya, man.
You can keep asking the same shit, but I got nothing more to say.
Drop the subject, dude.
Some other time, man.
Drop by later and maybe I can tell you more.
Eh, I ain't getting into much more depth, you have any other questions?
Bro, if I had all the answers I wouldn't be in this shit dump.
Good question. If you find out, share that info with me, will you?
You are putting me on the spot here, man. I don't know.
Hell if I know man.
There's always something going on in the Zone, but nothing I would like to share with you.
I've nothing to tell you, man; Nobody tells me shit.
You're asking the wrong guy.
I'd like to know that too.
Sorry, I can't help you.
Sorry, I can't help you.
How's it going?
Hey, man, what's up?
Hello, how are you?
Hello, brother.
Greetings, stalker.
I'm good, What's up?
Hello.
What's up?
What do you want?
So far, so good; you?
Been better days, what do you need?
Good-day!
Yeah, what is it?
Shove off, stalker.
What do you want?
Okay, just one damn question but all I better see after is asses and elbows.
What do you need, stalker?
Help! Please... I'm dying...
Help me, bro... Oh god, it hurts!
Friend, medkit... Give me a medkit...
Bro... Bro, save me!
Help me, bro... Don't... Don't let me die like this...
Stalker, help me... Give me a medkit...
I'm hurt... Help!
Screw this place!
Medkit!
I need medical attention!
Medkit! Quick!
Help! I'm dying!
I need first aid, guys! Hurry up!
What does it look like? I need a medkit, or at least a bandage!
Medic!
Just med me, bro. Just med me!
What do you know about anomalies?
You know anything about anomalies?
What can you tell me about anomalies?
I don't feel comfortable telling you anything.

Well, the Burner can be a bit difficult to see, even in daylight you can only see faint haze. If you piss it off with one of your bolts it'll shoot out a tall pillar of flame in the air, so don't stand too close.

Comet anomalies are a lot like the Burner, both fire-y, only this is a big floating ball of flame, flying about wherever you found it. Best to duck and dive about when near those things otherwise you'll get your ass burnt off.
Vortex's is some sorta floating thing, it'll drag everything within towards it and start spinning it around. If you get caught up in that you'll get splattered all over the place.

Springboards are these floating gravity balls, but you touch them and whoosh it'll blow up right in your face. You'll find them all over the place, you'll probably hear them humming to you before you see them.

You should keep an eye out for Whirlgigs, dirt and leaves blowing about is a pretty good indicator. I saw a flesh get pulled in to one when I was at the Cordon, started spinning around till is just tore itself apart from the force.

The Fruit Punch is a glowing puddle of green shit on the floor which'll hiss and spit at you. Might be able to get a good artefact from it if you're brave enough to get up next to it, but it'll melt your face off if you get a little too comfy.
Burnt Fuzz anomalies are usually found outdoors, they look like moss or vines, hanging down like curtains. Shoots these spores at you if you touch it though, like some kinda defence mechanism.
Look out for green Gas anomalies floating and wandering over the ground. It's acidic and if you end up taking a stroll into the stuff it'll start trying to eat away at your legs.
Keep your eyes pealed for Gas Cloud anomalies, if you see a flying ball of acid darting around, sneak around and under that thing or you'll wind up looking like a flesh.

You ever see those giant electrical puddles on the ground? Electros are what the scientists call them. Most of them will only go off something goes over an introduces itself, but half the time I swear they explode when there's nothing even there. Some of them seem to disappear for a few seconds too, if you can time it right then you can walk right past them no problem.

Few days ago I came across this floating ball of electricity, I think the eggheads named them after that electricity guy, Tesla or whatever his name was. Anyway, I was in this hallway and it was pacing up and down - no - flying up and down, across the hallway. Had to time it right and go bit by bit through the room, hiding behind old junk in the room and let it keep passing me.

You know that Forester guy over in the Red Forest says he got stuck in one of those Space anomalies? Said it was like an open field, endless with no way out. That was until he found a Compass artefact in there which showed him the exit, just like the rumours say they do. He says he got mugged by a bunch of Renegades and lost it, but personally I think the old coot's just losing his marbles.

Few years ago Clear Sky went after a stalker headed for the power plant, we all know how that ended, but there was this merc with them, Scar. The few of the people that survived the mess say these anomalies started showing up all over the place that let him teleport closer to the guy he was after, like the Zone was helping him. Weird shit.

Ever seen any jagged rocks sticking out from the ground with a bunch of warped trees nearby? Me neither. But I've heard there's one over in the Red Forest. Apparently those Symbiont anomalies are pretty good for artefacts, you can get all kinds of stuff outta them.

Ecologists are scratching their heads over those Fault anomalies. They're these cracks, huge fractures in the ground, usually have a whole bunch of Comets and other anomalies underneath them. They've no idea if they're just anomaly fields or if there's something else to them. When was the last time you've heard of an earthquake in Ukraine?
What's new in the Zone?
You know what's going on around here?
I'm looking for information.
I don't have any information.

The army set up a base over in Agroprom, right in the middle of it. Place is packed with dogs and other mutants just running around with nothing stopping them. By itself, it ain't so special, but there's this huge subterranean underground full of anomalies sitting right below it. If it weren't for the soldiers I'd be down there right now hauling a whole bunch of artefacts out of it.

The Agroprom Underground is sat underneath the research institute buildings. I hear different things about it all the time, one day I hear it's full of anomalies, perfect for artefact hunting, next it's barren, nothing but mutants, next I hear the place is full of controllers and poltergeists. I don't know what to believe, damned if I'll be going there with all the jarheads patrolling aboveground though.

You ever been to Bar? You've got the 100 Rads and the arena just across the street from each other to keep you busy. A real shining star in the middle of the Earth's asshole don't you think? Whole place used to be a giant factory complex so Duty found it perfect to set up their base of operations there. I'm not complaining though, they do a good job of keeping all the filth out, you won't seem any bandits or mutants about the place.

The Cordon is quieter than most other areas. Most stay at the Rookie village north of the actual military cordon outpost until they have enough gear and experience to head deeper into the Zone. You'll find Nimble and Sidorovich there too, Nimble'll help you get hold of really high-end gear, best of the best, while Sid sits down in his bunker where he'll sell you smuggled in goods; food, medical supplies, you get the idea.

Darkscape connects the southern edge of Dark Valley with the tunnel in the east of the Cordon. Full of forest, mutants, bandits and anomalies, but somehow you'll always find a group of loners down there for whatever reason. I wouldn't stick too close to the road either, you'll leave glowing from the radiation or you'll get torn apart by a pack of dogs.

Dark Valley is a forbidding place, filled with rusting wrecks and crumbling buildings. There's a few anomalies nearby where you can try your luck artefact hunting, but the bandits occupy the factory in the north, so good luck not getting mugged afterwards.

The Dead City is right between Yantar and Limansk with a whole gathering of mercs right in the middle. There's gotta be a huge stash of guns and meds in there somewhere, where else must they keep all their shit? If you wanna get through the place without getting your ass beat I heard you could sneak about through the sewers. Not much else I can tell you, bro.

You know they dumped all their ruined machines and vehicles after the disaster in Garbage right? Loners and bandits are always trying to get the best loot, shooting at each other all the time while trying not to get ate by the mutants. There's a whole grouping of anomalies in the car park too, you're almost guaranteed an artefact if you get there right after an emission hits.

Ever been to the Generators? They're found up north beyond the power plant, six of them in a ring formation with the old war lab not far south. Not much to look at besides a few old labs, but plenty of mutants to keep your gun busy while you're there if that's your thing.

We occupy nearly all of the Deserted Hospital, most of the paths through that lead further towards the Chernobyl NPP are fenced off by a machine gun emplacements or some other shit. No stalkers will be getting through there any time soon.

Jupiter is still unsettled - much like Zaton, and since they turned on the Brain Scorcher it's almost impossible to get to without putting your neck on the line. If you don't wanna get your brains scrambled then your only way in is through the Red Forest, not that you'll make it through alive with all the mutants and anomalies hiding behind all the trees.

Thinking of travelling through the Jupiter Underground? You'll need suit with a closed cycle respiratory module due to the harsh conditions within, but it'll let you go right beneath Pripyat Plaza directly to the Pripyat Outskirts, so you can avoid all the cultists.

Limansk is an empty place, full of derelict buildings and vehicles. I heard the mercs tried to push through it from the Dead City recently but didn't make it that far, lost too many to the anomalies and mutants.
The Swamps is mostly a wet and irradiated hole in the ground but you'll find a few abandoned buildings and settlements here and there which are worth looting.

Ever heard of the Army Warehouses? Freedom set up their headquarters there after they got their ass handed to them by bandits a couple years back, claim they're protecting the Zone by defending the barrier there which leads to Radar. Complete nonsense if you ask me, if the bandits could tear 'em a new one the Monolith would've more than done so by now.
The Monolith are hold up in Pripyat Plaza from what I've heard. No way of getting through all of the anomalies and mutants with them shooting at you the whole time.

You should consider checking out the Pripyat Outskirts, stalker, plenty of anomalies to make you rich, you won't even have to go through the plaza to get there either, just take the underground passed through Jupiter, no need to worry about the Monolith.

Those bastards turned the Brain Scorcher back on when they took Radar, there's no way to the other side of the Zone now unless you feel like feeding the local wildlife or being turned into one of those zombies like the ones you see in Yantar.

More and more stalkers have gotten themselves killed trying to get through the Red Forest since the Monolith took over Radar. The Forester can only do so much with your equipment to help, but I don't feel like sticking my balls in the frying pan for the sake of a few artefacts.

The Wild Territory used to be the site of a rather large manufacturing plant, but now the place is swarming with monsters and is full of anomalies. Only real reason to go through there is if you want to get to Bar, but there's plenty of other safe routes to use instead.

What would you wish for? What's the one thing you really want? hWell, help me find the Wish Granter and maybe it'll come to fruitation. I've heard it's buried under the power plant somewhere, do you think that maybe that's what the Monolith are fighting to protect?

Yantar is morbid and sodden with death. Anyone who dares to go too far goes insane. Zombies and snorks are all over the place just waiting to introduce themselves to you. They keep spewing out of that factory, half of the time when the Ecologists gun them down they realise it's one of their own men who was shooting at them. It's real fucked.

Hey stalker, if you're ever up in Zaton you should check out the Skadovsk, it's this old rusty ship run by this stalker calling himself Beard, or at least so he likes to think he does. You can find somewhere to sleep, repair your gear and sell all your loot. Owl's always interested in buying those extra PDAs off of your hands if they have any nice info on them.
Anyone posting jobs around here?
I'm looking for work.
Know where I can find work?
Sorry, I don't know.
Spore is always looking for someone to do odd jobs every now and again. He is an information broker. Got the scoop on something big going down in the Zone? Spore will pay well.

I heard Librarian has been seeking experienced hunters to clear out some mutants at different locations throughout the marshes. Seems to be less volunteers to go out hunting at night, so you'll have a better chance to get the job then.
Sidorovich always has something that needs done. He usually pays well but I don't recommend any rookie taking any job he offers.
Wolf has been looking for help. He pays stalkers to hunt mutants in the local area to ensure the safety of the village.
Owl, who hangs out at the Skadovsk, is always looking to buy or sell information. I would go ask him.
Sultan is seeking people with ball of steel for some shit. He hangs out at the Skadovsk, I would check there.
Head toward the scientists' bunker. I'm sure they have something. They are always looking for mercs or stalkers to help them out.
Olivius is the man to see if you are looking to do some odd jobs. He is a trader who stays at the Dark Valley camp.
Yeah, here's a job. From here, head west. Then keep going west. And when you've done that, don't come back.
Sorry man, I've got nothing for you. Just dig in and help us hold on to what we've got.
Know anything useful?
How do you manage to stay alive here?
What kind of advice can you give about the Zone?
I really don't have any advice to give you.
Shooting an enemy in the eye will result in an instant kill, regardless of his armour level.
The AC-96/2 has a unique two round burst firing mode. In this mode, both bullets in a burst will hit the same spot.
Double-barreled shotguns can be used to fire both barrels almost simultaneously.
Don't underestimate pistols. They provide considerable stopping power and can be very effective against poorly armoured targets.
Sniper rifles are ideal for eliminating enemies from a distance, thanks to their flatness and accuracy characteristics. They are less effective at close range.
Firing on the move is considerably less accurate than when you are standing still or crouching.
Weapons and protective suits will wear out quickly in the harsh conditions of the Zone. Worn-out weapons are less accurate and prone to misfire, while suits will not protect you as well.
Mechanics will require special equipment for certain upgrades. Returning this equipment to them will allow them to upgrade your weapons and equipment further.
Psi-storms, emissions and fallout will require you to take shelter. Standing out in the open during these events have consequences.
Butterfly mines can be used to set ambushes on other stalkers or mutants. Just make sure not to stand next to them after placement as they will explode regardless of whether you are friend or foe.
Jobs are not offered exclusively by traders and mechanics. Ordinary members of your faction may have for you to complete.
Some medical products have unique properties. For example, Hercules allows you to temporarily carry more weight, while psi-blocking drugs help you resist psi-attacks on your brain.
Vodka, a cheap alternative to antirad meds, is the easiest way to reduce the effects of radiation on the body.
You need a detector to search for artefacts. The best detectors make searching easier and may even detect more valuable artefacts.
You can locate the edges of an anomaly by throwing bolts.
As well as addressing your hunger, food will also slightly improve your health.
You can access detailed information about the current mission through your PDA.
Stalkers don't like it when you point your weapon at them and may ask you to hide it if they feel threatened. You should holster your weapon before you talk to other stalkers.
Energy drinks temporarily improve your endurance recovery, which increases your potential mobility.
Low endurance can make you immobile and vulnerable to enemy attack at crucial moments.
Having a detector in one hand doesn’t stop you from using a knife, pistol or bolt with your other hand.
You can toggle certain data on or off via the buttons located at the top of your PDA.
In addition to their useful effects, most artefacts are also radioactive. This can be compensated for by using artefacts that absorb radiation.
Your knife is ineffective against enemies armed with firearms. Use it in close combat or for a stealthy kill.
The weight you are carrying reduces your endurance. Excess weight will restrict your mobility, while being completely overloaded will stop you from moving altogether.
A detector is the only reliable way of checking anomalous areas for artefacts.
Most artefacts will remain invisible as they move around in the anomalous area, until they are identified by your detector.
Mutants are more active at night, which explains why stalkers prefer to wait for sunlight before venturing into the Zone.
If you have suffered serious radiation exposure, use anti-radiation drugs. If you don't have any, use medkits to deal with the initial symptoms and until you make it to a medic.
Many stalkers believe that the legendary Wish Granter exists and is hidden somewhere within the Chernobyl NPP.

Selling artefacts isn’t the only way to make some cash: offloading unneeded equipment can be a profitable business, too. Keep in mind that traders aren’t usually interested in items that are seriously damaged.
If you want to move with minimal noise, you should try to sneak around by crouching.
You can attach items to your weapons, such as scopes, silencers or under-barrel grenade launchers.
Shotguns are close-combat weapons. The further your enemy is from you, the less effective they are.
When taking cover from small arms fire, make sure to hide behind something solid. Unlike concrete walls, wooden boards and sheet metal don't make for very safe cover.
Bandages should be used immediately to prevent bleeding. Whilst bleeding you will gradually lose health and will end up having to use a medkit.
Each type of mutant in the Zone has its own combat traits. If you take these into account, you will be far more likely to survive.
Enemies can and will use grenades. When you see the grenade hurled towards you, leave the kill zone immediately.
Speeding up before you jump allows you to overcome big gaps and cracks.
The Zone has a life of its own, which means that there’s always a chance of bumping into mutants or enemy stalkers in areas that you have already cleared.
Stay alert in the Zone and don’t rely on old information. When you return to an anomalous area you’ve already explored, you may find that the old tested path is no longer available.
You can hold more than one weapon at any time. This allows you to create flexible weapon combinations, such as assault rifle and shotgun, or a pistol and sniper rifle.
Every trader you encounter in various stalker camps offers his own, unique range of goods. As an example, medics are bound to have the best selection of medical products.
If you get to a stalker camp wounded or with radiation poisoning, you can make use of assistance from the local medic.
Smash open any boxes and small metal containers you see. You may find food or medical items which you can then use or sell.
If you need to wait for a specific hour you can take a nap at the camp to pass the time.
The night vision device in your helmet can be upgraded to the next-generation version. This will expand its coverage range considerably.
When out in the Zone, keep some spare ammunition boxes on you - they’re bound to come in handy.
To use drugs appropriately it helps to know what they do. Consult drug descriptions to find out the effects of certain drugs.
Use grenades to attack enemies in cover. Keep in mind the grenade’s blast radius to avoid hurting friendly fighters.
Help!
Take a first aid kit.
Sorry, I don't have a medkit.
Ok.
What are you doing now?
Can you take me with you?
Of course. The company is always more fun.
No, sorry. I work better alone.
Let's go.
Could you take me somewhere? I'll pay.
No problem. Where do you want to go? Choose.
Ok. Come on.
I've changed my mind.
Not right now.
Oh, nothing.
Nothing. Just relaxing.
What does it look like? I'm being lazy...
I'm hunting a mutant.
I'm on the trail of some bandit scum.
Tracking some mercenaries... Those guys are the bastards.
I'm on the trail of a squad of fanatics. They call themselves "Monolith"...
We are chasing a zombie. Empty shells of once great stalkers, poor wretches...
Good. It will cost you
I've changed my mind.
I have no money.
I'm not doing anything.
I'm on the trail of some mutants.
I'm taking part in the local bandit chase.
I'm following some mercenaries. They must pay for attacking us.
We are after some crackpots from "Monolith".
"Duty" is somewhere around here, bastards can't be too far away.
We are not doing anything.
We are purging this area of mutants.
I'm on a job - chasing a bandit detachment.
We were attacked by mercs, I won't rest until they are dead.
We are hunting down a squad of those "Monolith" freaks.
We are cleaning out the trash that call themselves "Freedom".
I'm searching for artefacts.
We're collecting mushrooms... What do you think we're doing idiot? We are looking for artefacts.
I am artefact hunting.
Is any of my equipment ready for pickup?
Yes, here you are.
Not yet, check back later.
...I give up.
Hand over your weapons and give me a piece of vital information - a stash's location, a supply exchange point, an ambush you're planning, whatever, and I'll let you live.
Where did you put your fucking stuff? Tell me! And I will consider saving your sorry ass!
Here's a medkit, but I'm taking your weapons.
Any last words? I've come to collect the bounty on your head.
You'll live.
Good luck...
Time to end you.
Okay, okay, just don't kill me!
Fuck! Okay.
Please, man! I will tell you!
Please, Don't kill me! Take my PDA! It has everything you need to know on it!
Go fuck yourself!
Thank you!
That bastard Sidorovich sent you, didn't he? What do you want!? Cash? Here, have my PDA and my money, just let me live!
You souless fuck! Do you even know why you were sent to kill me? Do you even give a fuck? Sid can burn in hell.
Fuck you!
Just put me out of my god damn misery already! Do it!
That bastard Sultan sent you, didn't he? What do you want!? Cash? Here, have my PDA and my money, just let me live!
You souless fuck! Do you even know why you were sent to kill me? Do you even give a fuck? Sultan can burn in hell.
Fuck you!
Just put me out of my god damn misery already! Do it!
I have something you want.
I have something else you may want.
I found a PDA, might have something useful on it.
I found %s PDAs, some of them might have useful information.
Here.
I'll be the judge of that, what do you have?
You better hope it is, because you are wasting my god damn time.
This better be worth my time, what do you have?
Alright, let me see.
Nothing useful.
A couple of stashes.
Contacts on local drug dealers.
A journal.
Coordinates of a stash.
Just some more bullshit.
Nothing useful on this one.
Some useful contact information.
Useless, but someone might buy it.
Mostly junk, I could find a buyer.
Some useful information.
A list of passwords.
There's some bank details.
Ain't much on this one.
This one mentions a local meeting going down.
Detailed observations regarding mutations on local flora.
Looks like an awesome game on this one.
Detailed observations regarding fleshes.
Detailed observations regarding boars.
Detailed observations regarding Whirlgig anomalies.
I know some people who will want this one.
Photos of a Freedomer trying to screw a bloodsucker.
A contact on a drug dealer.
Encrypted, might be valuable.
This one mentions a stash location.
This one is encrypted.
Crazy journal entries on this one.
Some useful contact information.
Smuggling route information.
I could find a buyer for this one here.
Some useful information on this one.
Bank account information.
This mentions a meeting between Duty and a local gang of thugs.
There is coordinates here for a supply exchange point.
This one mentions a local meeting going down.
Detailed information about rats and hamsters.
Information on a shortcut through Red Forest.
Porn... This one is full of porn.
Detailed observations on a variety of anomalies.
Lots of chat logs over StalkIRC.
Fantastic, some dirt on Beard.
Mentions of a huge stash, I'll take this for sure.
Great! This mentions a drug smuggler making dealing with the military.
Encrypted, might be valuable; I'll keep this one.
This one mentions a location of a stash.
Encrypted. If they have something to hide, it may be something I want.
This one has detailed information about Duty... Freedom might want this.
Bank account and credit card information.
Alleged location of the Oasis.
I could find a buyer for this one here.
Some useful information on this one.
Unencrypted passwords and bank account information.
This mentions a meeting between some mercs and local thugs.
There is coordinates here for a supply exchange point.
This one mentions a local meeting going down in a few days.
Maps! A regular cartographer! This one is very useful.
Shortcut information through an anomaly field.
Upcoming supply exchange point here.
Scientists might want this one.
What the? This one just says "Kill Strelok".
As a bonus, here are some coordinates to stashes I don't really care to get:
Do you have any work that needs done?
The job is done.
What? I don't think you've finished what I've asked.
I'll do it.
Have anything else?
Good! Talk to me again when it's done.
Come through for me and I'll come through for you. Get back to me.
Glad you can be of assistance.
Thank you, stalker, here is your reward.
I'm glad you came through. Here is what I've promised:
Okay, now for your payment.
Sorry, don't have anything.
I can't remember what I was going to say... Just go get it, you know what I want!
Return for your reward.
On second thought, nevermind. Come back later.
